history.content: It is difficult to predict how many spots will still be open. However, you may remain on the waitlist if you would like. During the adjustment period any remaining reserved categories that did not fill will be released to those on the waitlist.

<md>Hi! I'm not in the groups with enrollment priority/reserved seats for EECS 16A and I'm wondering how likely it is that I'll get in if I add myself to the waitlist at the start of phase 2. My phase 2 enrollment appointment is 16 Nov but I imagine many of the remaining seats will be filled by people with priority during phase 2. Based on [BerkeleyTime](https://berkeleytime.com/enrollment/0-15687-spring-2020-305283&1-15687-spring-2021-349320&2-15687-spring-2022-401588), it seems like the number of people enrolled at this point in the enrollment process is slightly lower than in Spring 2021 and Spring 2020, but the class capacity dropped from 700 in Spring 2020 to 508 in Spring 2022. It also seems like more of the seats are filled at this point for spring semesters than for fall semesters, which isn't what I would have expected. The class schedule listing for Spring 2022 is [here](https://classes.berkeley.edu/content/2022-spring-eecs-16a-001-lec-001).

Does anyone have any insight on enrolling in this class when you don't qualify for reserved seats? Is there a chance capacity could expand? Do lots of people drop that class? If there's little to no chance of me getting in at this point, I might phase 2 a different class and phase 1 EECS 16A in a future semester (although those are limited) or take it over the summer if it's offered then.</md>
history.subject: EECS 16A enrollment likelihood
